item.title: Super Powers
item.author: pmeckoni@gmail.com (Prashant Meckoni)
item.description: Humans have been obsessed with superheroes since ages. The current superheroes depicted in movies and comics belonging to the DC universe and the Marvel universe are a subset of the superheroes known to us through history. Greek mythology has given us with superheroes like Atlas and Heracles. Heracles is recognized as Hercules in Roman mythology. Germanic mythology gave us Thor. Religion have given us individuals with a wide range of supernatural powers, giving us someone to look up to.

item.title: Adding todo notes in LaTeX
item.author: pmeckoni@gmail.com (Prashant Meckoni)
item.description: Many researchers and programmers have a tendency to add todo and fixme to their comments to mark stuff to be fixed. Such placeholders are available in \(\LaTeX\) too. The easiest way is to use the todonotes package.

item.title: Counting words in LaTeX
item.author: pmeckoni@gmail.com (Prashant Meckoni)
item.description:
Counting words typed in \(\rm\LaTeX\) is difficult using standard text editors because macros, commands, and the math syntax can interfere in the word count.

TeX Live provides texcount to help count the number of words accurately.

item.title: Keeping warm during winter in New England
item.author: pmeckoni@gmail.com (Prashant Meckoni)
item.description: If you are new to Amherst or New England, or new to the cold weather, and interested in knowing more about winter clothing and survival, I find this reddit tip very useful. It does not have information for keeping kids warm. So I intend to share my experience for keeping kids warm when you go outdoors. For my family, most of the outdoor time was walking down to and from the bus stop, and waiting for the bus.
